title: runtime: "unexpected fault address 0x0" during GC
body:
by **mitchell.hashimoto**: 
Go version:
go version go1.1.2 linux/amd64

While I haven't been able to reproduce this, a handful of users of my software have been
seeing this regularly:

https://gist.github.com/mitchellh/6283509

It appears to be a SIGSEGV during hashmap access during GC. I'm sorry I can't provide
much more information. If you need to point the stack traces back at my own code, here
is the code in question (tagged so it won't change):
https://github.com/mitchellh/packer/tree/v0.3.3
